item.title: Top Lightroom Tip That Your Clients Will Thank You For Learning | Fstoppers
item.description:
Top Lightroom Tip That Your Clients Will Thank You For Learning | Fstoppers

If you are photographing people than you understand the importance of sharpening areas of your images while masking out other parts and keeping them soft. For example, I love to sharpen the eyes, the lips, the hair, but don't want to bring out any unnecessary detail on the cheeks.

item.title: Another Useful Lightroom Tip Your Mom Never Taught You | Fstoppers
item.description:
Another Useful Lightroom Tip Your Mom Never Taught You | Fstoppers

Adobe Lightroom is a program full of many different little tips and tricks just waiting to be discovered. In this short video I show you one of my favorites which allows you to apply a selective focus technique to your photo without having to open it in Photoshop.

item.title: Are You Taking Advantage Of The Survey View in Lightroom? | Fstoppers
item.description:
Are You Taking Advantage Of The Survey View in Lightroom? | Fstoppers

Like Photoshop, Lightroom is a powerful piece of software. Sadly most of us learn the basics and don't take advantage of all that is has to offer. One powerful feature is called the "Survey View." Are you taking advantage of it?

item.title: How To Make Fantastic Wedding Photos Even When It's Raining | Fstoppers
item.description:
How To Make Fantastic Wedding Photos Even When It's Raining | Fstoppers

Rain on your wedding day can be quite a downer for most brides even though many cultures see rain as good fortune, cleansing and fertility. Often brides wonder how they are going to still get good photos if it's raining. Here are some tips for photographers that I've picked up over the years having shot numerous weddings in the rain.

item.title: Simple Tip To Mastering Off-Camera Flash (2-Min Read) | Fstoppers
item.description:
Simple Tip To Mastering Off-Camera Flash (2-Min Read) | Fstoppers

Over the last 12-months there has been a surge of photographers wanting to learn off-camera flash. Regularly I receive emails or Facebook messages from other photographers asking for tips. Over the years I have tried to remember what made learning off-camera flash so easy for me and time and time again it comes down to one simple tip.

item.title: Using Lightroom Export Presets to Speed Up Your Workflow | Fstoppers
item.description:
Using Lightroom Export Presets to Speed Up Your Workflow | Fstoppers

Often when we are editing in Lightroom we find ourselves doing the same tasks over and over again. The key to speeding up your workflow is finding ways to minimize the amount of steps it takes to do these regular tasks and fortunately Lightroom gives us many options to do this.

item.title: Five Great Ways To Customize Your 5D Mark III | Fstoppers
item.description:
Five Great Ways To Customize Your 5D Mark III | Fstoppers

You finally got that Canon 5D Mark III camera you have been desiring and now you are trying to figure out how best to take advantage of all it's great new features. Here are five ways I have customized my camera to best fit my needs while shooting weddings, events and portraits.

item.title: My 6 Favorite Travel Tips | Fstoppers
item.description:
My 6 Favorite Travel Tips | Fstoppers

As a wedding photographer and workshop instructor I travel quite frequently. In the last couple of years I have been all over the world and throughout this time I have picked up a number of great travel tips. Here are six of my favorites that will hopefully make your next trip more enjoyable.

item.title: Can You Tell The Difference Between a $100 Lens and a $1600 Lens? | Fstoppers
item.description:
Can You Tell The Difference Between a $100 Lens and a $1600 Lens? | Fstoppers

One of the most popular lens lengths on the market is the 50mm. As a Canon shooter I have a few different choices to pick from at that length, but the three most popular seem to be the 50mm 1.8, 50mm 1.4 and 50mm 1.2.

item.title: Simple But Great Tip To Naming Your Photography Folders | Fstoppers
item.description:
Simple But Great Tip To Naming Your Photography Folders | Fstoppers

There is no wrong or right way of naming the folders on your computer. It is really just a matter of preference and what works best in your workflow. Having been doing this for a number of years though I have experimented with quite a few different ways and this is by far the one I like best.
